Notes.Mortality: Sample model that produces outputs that make sense.
Notes.Supplementation:
ADDED THE SAME CONDITION FOR HARVEST FOR RELEASE. DON'T UNDERSTAND WHY THERE ARE NUMBERS IN THE HOLDING POP...
ADDED UNNECESSARY EQUATION CONSTRAINING RELEASE AS PRACTICE FOR WHEN MORE POPS

Notes.Harvest:
Start in year one, end in year 2, take 50 indivdiuals from each source population.
you can play around with the numbers to see "how many are needed for a viable recipient popualtion".
Notes.Supplementation:
Release 50 males and 50 females to the recipient population in each of years 1 and 2.
If numbers here are lower than the total number harvested, there will be remnant individuals in the holding population.
If numnbers are higher, **i believe**the number moved will be only that available

Notes.Harvest: Only one year of harvest, "species year" 3. Get 100 Males and females from each of the two source populations.
Notes.Supplementation:
Release 300 males and 300 females in year 3 into each of the two recipient populations.
We care which individuals go where, so we use a formula to set criteria:
=IF((Y=3)AND(T=3);(IS1=1);IF((Y=3)AND(T=4);(IS1=2);0))
The formula provides the following directions:
In year 3 (Y=3) if the recipient population is population 3 (Recipient 1, T=3) then get individuals from population 1 (Source 1, IS1=1), otherwise get them from population 2 (Souirce 2; IS2=2), teh rest of the time, don't release any (;0).

Notes.Harvest:
Note that here variable harvest through time is specified in source 1, while sucre three just has a one-off specified number.
Note, the numbers specified here don't match the numbers released.
You can see that extra individuals end up in the holding pop. Edit the values to make sure they match :)
Notes.Supplementation:
Source site combos specified in the optional criteria for release with the same method for SCENARIO 3. However, note that harvest and release in recipient 1 are now happening over a 3 year period, and in each year, different sources are permitted, so the equation has been adapted to reflect that.
I have also added conditions in the numbers release to permit variable numbers in multiple years using the following equation:
IF(Y=1;50;IF(Y=3;50;IF(Y=4; 50;0) Which says, if year 1 release 25, year 3 50. year 4 75.
Note that the number of M and F for both supplementation and harvest also need to be specifed with aligned conditional statements.
Note that the numbers in the conditionals are aligned with the number harvested.
